generif.text: microRNA regulation is a conserved feature of the Lin-28 gene in diverse animals.

that LIN28 was a negative independent predictor for both overall survival and recurrence-free survival in hepatocellular carcinoma patients who met the Milan criteria. LIN28 was expressed at a higher frequency in tumor tissues than in non-HCC tissues.

consequential impacts of USP28-mediated stabilization of LIN28A protein on enhancing cancer cell viability, migration and ultimately augmenting LIN28A-mediated tumor progression. Study in Chinese patients provides evidence that Lethal-7-related polymorphisms represent a genetic factor that modifies the susceptibility to and prognosis of gastric cancer (GC). Individuals carrying the C allele of rs3811463 in the 3'-UTR of LIN28A have a lower risk of GC, and GC patients with the C allele of rs10889677 in the 3'-UTR of IL23R have a shorter lifespan than patients without it.

name: lin-28 homolog A

reactome.name: Transcriptional regulation of pluripotent stem cells

summary: This gene encodes a LIN-28 family RNA-binding protein that acts as a posttranscriptional regulator of genes involved in developmental timing and self-renewal in embryonic stem cells. The encoded protein functions through direct interaction with target mRNAs and by disrupting the maturation of certain miRNAs involved in embryonic development. This protein prevents the terminal processing of the LET7 family of microRNAs which are major regulators of cellular growth and differentiation. Aberrant expression of this gene is associated with cancer progression in multiple tissues. [provided by RefSeq, Sep 2015].
